src.data.features.points

Helper functions for building engineered features for team points.

src.data.features.points.adjust_for_opponent(base, opponent)[source]

Adjust base data for opponent strength.

Parameters:

  • base (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)) – Base data to adjust. Must have season/team/week/opponent multiindex.

  • opponent (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)) – Opponent data to use for adjustment. Must have season/team/week/opponent multiindex.

Returns:

Adjusted data.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)

src.data.features.points.build_points_features(raw_games_path, window)[source]

Build all points features (e.g. net points).

Parameters:

  • raw_games_path (str) – Path to raw games data.

  • window (int) – Number of weeks to use for rolling averages.

src.data.features.points.calculate_avgs(points, window)[source]

Calculate averages per team per week per season with expanding or rolling windows.

Parameters:

  • points (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)) – Points for/against indexed by season, team, and week.

  • window (int) – Number of weeks to use for rolling averages.

Returns:

Points per game averages indexed by season, team, and week.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)

src.data.features.points.make_base_points_data(games)[source]

Build base points data (e.g. points for and against) for feature creation.

Parameters:

games (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_games, n_features)) – Raw games data.

Returns:

Points for/against indexed by season, team, and week.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, 5)

src.data.features.points.reframe_team_as_opponent(df)[source]

Transform a df index such that ‘team’ is now ‘opponent’.

Parameters:

df (pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)) – Dataframe with season/team/week multiindex.

Returns:

Dataframe with season/opponent/week multiindex.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame of shape (n_samples, n_features)
